title: Input value from state but still update onChange
body:
I came across this intriguing problem when trying to set value for an input from state.
I want to have an input get its value from state (that is connected to a store), and also I want to update _onChange_ the value in the store through an action.

```
_updateInputField(type, e) {
    ActionToStore(type, e.target.value) // Store will 'trigger' modification for type variable in state
}

[...]

<input
       onChange={this._updateInputField.bind(null, 'name')}
       value={this.state.name} />
```

A huge problem this approach presents is that the input will get _very_ _slow_ when typing new characters due to the fact that this requires a new render of the component.

So, I started implementing _onBlur_ method and drop _onChange_, but I got a warning saying that the component will only be _read_ _only_ because it doesn't have an _onChange_ method.

I also looked into _Two Way Binding_ that handles setting the state and updating the value of a component but got the same laggish result.

Also, another big problem with this is whenever I set state with a new value, i.e. when I type new characters, the typing cursor is reset to the end of the text in the input, so if I try to edit inside the current text I only get to enter one character before the cursor moves to the end.

Is there a better official approach for these problems and if not is this a known problem and set to be solved in React's next versions?
